intro: Lastrea glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, often surrounded by glandular hairs that give it its scientific name. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, sticky secretions. Lastrea glanduligera is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
